amendment_analysis.summary: Section 48O of the Personal Data Protection Act 2012 was amended by Act 40 of 2020, introducing a private right of action and related procedural provisions. The 2020 revised edition of the Act, which incorporates all amendments up to 1 December 2021, became effective on 31 December 2021. No amendments after 2021 were found in the provided sources.
key_changes: Introduction of a private right of action for persons suffering loss or damage due to a contravention (s48O(1)).
Provision allowing civil proceedings in court for such loss or damage (s48O(1)).
Clarification that actions may proceed even if the PDPC has made a decision on the contravention (s48O(2)).
Restriction that no application for reconsideration can be made against a decision under subsection (6)(b) (s48O(7)).
amendment_dates: 31 December 2021 (effective date of the 2020 revised edition incorporating the amendment)
sources: https://sso.agc.gov.sg/Act/PDPA2012 (Result 1 – notes that the 2020 revised edition incorporates amendments up to 1 December 2021)
https://sso.agc.gov.sg/Act/PDPA2012?ProvIds=P19C- (Result 2 – shows the text of s48O with citation [40/2020])

amendment_analysis.summary: Official Singapore Statutes Online shows that the Personal Data Protection Act 2012 (2020 Revised Edition) – which already incorporated amendments up to 1 December 2021 – has further amendments affecting sections 13‑17. Notably, Amendment 40/2020 introduced new conditions for the use/disclosure of personal data collected on or after 1 February 2021, with transitional provisions for data collected earlier. Subsequent amendment dates (1 April 2022 and 1 October 2022) are listed in the amendment history, indicating continued updates after the 2020 revised edition.
key_changes: Amendment 40/2020 (effective 1 Feb 2021): added new criteria for use/disclosure of personal data collected on or after that date, and transitional provisions for data collected before that date (affecting ss 13‑17).
Inclusion of transitional provisions ensuring that data collected before 1 Feb 2021 remains subject to the pre‑amendment rules (section 13‑17 references).
Later amendments recorded on 1 Apr 2022 and 1 Oct 2022 (details not fully shown in snippets) suggest further refinements to the same sections.
amendment_dates: 31 December 2021 (2020 Revised Edition came into operation)

amendment_analysis.summary: The 2020 Revised Edition of the Personal Data Protection Act 2012 incorporates all amendments up to 1 December 2021 (effective 31 December 2021). Subsequent amendment dates (April 2022, October 2022) are recorded for the Act overall, but the text of section 18 remains unchanged in the available sources. No specific amendment to s 18 is identified.
amendment_dates: 1 December 2021 (latest incorporated amendment in the 2020 Revised Edition)
April 2022 (subsequent amendment to the Act, not to s 18)
October 2022 (subsequent amendment to the Act, not to s 18)
sources: https://sso.agc.gov.sg/Act/PDPA2012 (Result 1 – amendment timeline and note that the 2020 revised edition incorporates amendments up to 1 Dec 2021)

amendment_analysis.summary: Section 24 of the Personal Data Protection Act 2012 was amended in 2020 (Amendment Bill 40/2020). The amendment introduced an additional security obligation concerning the loss of storage media or devices. The 2020 revised edition of the Act incorporates this change and all amendments up to 31 December 2021.
key_changes: Addition of clause (b) requiring organisations to protect personal data against loss of any storage medium or device on which the data is stored (introduced by Amendment 40/2020).
amendment_dates: Effective in the 2020 Revised Edition (operational from 31 December 2021)

amendment_analysis.summary: Official sources show that the PDPA 2012 (2020 Revised Edition) incorporates amendments up to 1 December 2021 and that subsequent legislative activity (e.g., Bill 37 of 2020) introduced a new Part VIB on Data Portability immediately after section 26E. The revised edition also notes specific amendments to sections 26C(3)(a) and 26E, confirming recent changes to the provisions covering sections 26A–26E.
key_changes: Insertion of Part VIB (Data Portability) immediately after section 26E, creating new obligations and definitions related to data porting.
Amendment to section 26C(3)(a) – specific wording changed (details in the 2020 amendment bill).
Amendment to section 26E – revised provisions (details in the 2020 amendment bill).
Inclusion of all amendments up to 1 December 2021 in the 2020 Revised Edition, effective 31 December 2021.
amendment_dates: 1 December 2021 (effective date of the 2020 Revised Edition incorporating amendments)
October 2022 (latest amendment listed on the SSO page)
sources: https://sso.agc.gov.sg/Act/PDPA2012 (2020 Revised Edition notes – incorporates amendments up to 1 Dec 2021, effective 31 Dec 2021)
https://www.parliament.gov.sg/docs/default-source/default-document-library/personal-data-protection-(amendment)-bill-37-2020.pdf (Bill 37 of 2020 inserting Part VIB after section 26E)
